info.name: Destiny HTTP API
info.description:
This collection includes all the standard HTTP API requests available for the Destiny API.

Please see our Destiny API Quick Start Guide if you haven't yet.

request.description: Sends a notice email to support personel.

response.name: 200 OK

request.description: Sends a warning email to support.

response.name: 200 OK

request.description: Sends an email about an error to support.

response.name: 200 OK

request.description: Requests the data for a previously submitted user registration.

Performs a user login request. If successful an HTTP code `200 OK` will be returned together with a new authorization token. Look at the `Authorization` header in the response, it will contain something like `bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1...`. 

> **Important:** This token must be cached by you and supplied with each subsequent requests to the API through the `Authorization` HTTP header.

> **Important:** The token is refreshed every few minutes by the API server. When any request is made by you and you receive the `Authorization` header, update your cache with the new token and then send the new token with each subsequent request. The old token does not immediately expire and is valid for 7 days.

response.name: 200 OK
425 User Not Found
401 Unauthorized

request.description: Log the user out.
Performs a password reset request for the given email address.
Performs a password reset based on the provided data.
Provide a previous registration token and the users data to complete the user's registration process.
A request to see if the server responds to the requests.

response.name: 200 OK
